intro: Stenogyne lactea, commonly known as the milkweed vine, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its milky sap, which gives it its common name, is a distinctive botanical feature. Stenogyne lactea plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and invertebrates.
